intro: Duvernoia brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed duvernoia, is a rare and unique plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Its flowers are inconspicuous, consisting of unisexual male and female structures, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
